alert.note: Alert for Coastal Bryan; Coastal Chatham; Coastal Liberty; Inland Bryan; Inland Liberty (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 12:49PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN, LIBERTY, MCINTOSH AND CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 1249 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Riceboro, or 10 miles southeast of Hinesville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Midway, Riceboro, Belfast, Halfmoon Landing, St. Catherines Island, Retreat, Keller and Sunbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Bryan; Coastal Chatham; Coastal Liberty; Inland Bryan; Inland Liberty
